In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is a simple Julia function that does exactly what you've described:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]+" => "_")
end
```
This function first strips all leading and trailing whitespace from the column name (`strip(col)`), then converts it to lower case (`lowercase(col)`). It then uses a regular expression (`r"[\s-]+"`), which matches one or more spaces or hyphens, to replace any such sequences with an underscore.

You can use this function as follows:
```julia
println(clean_column(" My Column "))  # Outputs "my_column"
```
